item.title: Social care: PM to unveil overhaul of sector in England
item.description: Boris Johnson will set out changes to the system, amid a Tory backlash over tax rises to cover costs.

item.title: Whitehaven coal mine: Planning inquiry begins into scheme
item.description: Supporters say the mine will bring jobs while opponents say it undermines climate change promises.

item.title: More migrants cross English Channel in small boats
item.description: Weather conditions have become more favourable for those making the journey.

item.title: Foster carer approval 'like winning the lottery'
item.description: Matt and Trish say they were initially terrified but "worries and fears" soon disappear.

item.title: Kickboxer Saeideh Aletaha: Brothers feared fatal fight was unfair
item.description: Saeideh Aletaha, 26, died a day after being knocked out at an organised bout in Southampton in 2019.

item.title: Muppets creator Jim Henson's Hampstead home given blue plaque
item.description: The plaque is on the Hampstead house where Jim Henson lived for more than a decade.

item.title: Roy 'Chubby' Brown: Sheffield cancellation sparks backlash
item.description: More than 28,000 people sign a petition urging venue bosses in Sheffield to reverse their decision.

item.title: Poodle killed in 'horrific' dog attack in Poplar
item.description: Ruby's owner wants a change in the law to allow owners to be prosecuted for dog-on-dog attacks.

item.title: ‘Rare’ Bath city-centre parking space sold for £115,000
item.description: The spot in the middle of Bath was sold just two days after being listed online.

item.title: Only Fools and Horses star John Challis cancels tour due to ill health
item.description: Herefordshire actor John Challis' tour is cancelled due to ill health, promoters say.

item.title: Farnborough 1952 air show crash victims remembered after 69 years
item.description: Thirty-one people died when a De Havilland jet broke up over the Farnborough Air Show.

item.title: 'Why not have festivals that only women can attend?'
item.description: The idea for the three-day LBTQ Femme Fest was conceived on social media during lockdown.

item.title: Meteor caught on camera over Southampton docks
item.description: The shooting star was captured on camera over Southampton docks on Sunday night.

item.title: Should Whitehaven's planned coal mine be allowed?
item.description: Whitehaven residents share their thoughts on what could become the UK's first deep mine in 30 years.

item.title: London's unemployment situation explained
item.description: Why is the capital's unemployment rate is higher than the rest of the UK?

item.title: 'I hid my litter picker in my suitcase'
item.description: Jenny I'Anson, 73, says she can spend up to five hours a day clearing rubbish.

item.title: US Open: Why it is right to be excited about 'wise' & 'fearless' Emma Raducanu
item.description: As British teenager Emma Raducanu reaches the US Open quarter-finals, BBC Sport looks at why it is right to be excited by her journey.

item.title: George Russell: Mercedes sign British F1 driver to partner Lewis Hamilton from 2022
item.description: Mercedes announce British driver George Russell will partner Lewis Hamilton from next season.

item.title: Emily Scarratt: England vice-captain has surgery on broken leg
item.description: England vice-captain Emily Scarratt has had surgery on a broken leg - almost a year out from the start of the postponed 2021 Rugby World Cup.
